item.title: The Ethereum Hardfork Advances Blockchain Governance and Technology
item.description:
The Ethereum Hardfork Advances Blockchain Governance and Technology

The fundamental assumption of any blockchain, whether public or private, is that 51% of actors are honest. For this assumption to hold, there must be decentralization (a sufficiently large number of individual/entity actors to such extent that exercising direct influence on 51% of actors is unfeasible) in four key aspects: developers, miners/stakers, exchanges/businesses, and media platforms. To place weight on their influence is difficult due to the balance of power between these four fundamental pillars.

item.title: Making Bitcoin Beautiful: Cryptoart Combines Art With Bitcoin Wallets
item.description:
Making Bitcoin Beautiful: Cryptoart Combines Art With Bitcoin Wallets

While mainstream adoption grows everyday, Bitcoin still traces its roots to the tech community. A 2013 survey of Bitcoin users found them to be 96% male, 37% anarcho-capitalist or libertarian, and with a median age of 32.7 years old.

item.title: Ether Withdrawals Slow as Millions in DAO Funds Remain Unclaimed - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ether Withdrawals Slow as Millions in DAO Funds Remain Unclaimed - CoinDesk

Millions of dollars worth of ether remain unclaimed from a smart contract established for the purpose of allowing investors in The DAO to recover funds compromised in the project's demise. Of the 11.6m ETH moved to the contract by way of a change in the code made to the underlying ethereum platform earlier this week, nearly 60% of the funds, or about 6.85m ETH, have so far been withdrawn.

item.title: US man jailed over bitcoin fraud scheme - BBC News
item.description:
US man jailed over bitcoin fraud scheme - BBC News

A Texan man has been sentenced to 18 months in jail for running a fraudulent Ponzi-style scheme based around the Bitcoin virtual currency. The scheme - run by Trendon Shavers - promised high returns to those who backed bitcoin-related investments. Instead of investing cash, Shavers used it to pay early investors in the scheme and to amass bitcoins.

item.title: Erns & Young Report: Prepare For Blockchain 'Critical Mass'
item.description:
Erns & Young Report: Prepare For Blockchain 'Critical Mass'

Ernst & Young (EY), the third largest multinational professional services firm, believes blockchain technology is poised for critical mass. In its Also Read: 'Radical Political Decentralization' Could End Nation States latest report, "Blockchain Reaction: Tech companies plan for critical mass," the company explains how tech firms will experience impact through the blockchain's "potential-rich, but still immature, technology."

item.title: Moody's Clients Working on 120 Blockchain Projects, Report Shows - CoinDesk
item.description:
Moody's Clients Working on 120 Blockchain Projects, Report Shows - CoinDesk

As many as 120 blockchain-related projects are being undertaken by governments and companies rated by credit agency Moody's, new data shows. Many of the projects have been publicly disclosed, and the report cites initiatives like the Hyperledger Projects as well as both regional and global finance consortiums as major drivers of issuer participation.

item.description:

Ethereum price is currently trading with a positive bias against the US Dollar, and if the current trend remains intact more gains are likely. Ethereum price is currently trading with a positive bias against the US Dollar, and if the current trend remains intact more gains are likely.

item.title: Bitcoin Savings & Trust Ponzi Scheme Operator Sentenced To 18 Months In Jail
item.description:
Bitcoin Savings & Trust Ponzi Scheme Operator Sentenced To 18 Months In Jail

Operating a Bitcoin Ponzi scheme is not only morally wrong, but it is also punishable by law. Albeit most countries around the world do not officially recognize Bitcoin as a currency, defrauding other people is a criminal offense. One man in Texas has been sentenced for operating such a Bitcoin Ponzi Scheme, and he will face 18 months in prison.
